thread.title: Gareth Bale stars in brilliant 'Don't Take Me Home' film tracking Wales's superb Euro 2016 run
thread.title_full: Gareth Bale stars in brilliant 'Don't Take Me Home' film tracking Wales's superb Euro 2016 run

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Gareth Bale stars in brilliant 'Don't Take Me Home' film tracking Wales's superb Euro 2016 run
text:
Sport Gareth Bale stars in brilliant 'Don't Take Me Home' film tracking Wales's superb Euro 2016 run The film has been directed by Jonny Owen - the man who brought us the superb I Believe In Miracles Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Epic trailer for film about Wales at Euro 2016 Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Watch the brilliant trailer for Jonny Owen's latest football masterpiece, 'Don't Take Me Home', above. 
The documentary follows Wales throughout their incredible Euro 2016 run. Chris Coleman's side famously defied the odds to beat tournament favourites Belgium en route to reaching the semi-finals. 
It was the first major tournament Wales had qualified for since 1958. And the qualification became especially poignant when the Wales players had to overcome the death of former manager Gary Speed. 
The documentary encapsulates the emotional and brave run Wales had in 2016. The Wales boys were in good spirits during the tournament Bale was crucial to Wales's success 
Director Owen had previously brought us the superb 'I Believe In Miracles', which was the story about the Nottingham Forest side who won back-to-back European Cups in 1979 and 1980. 
As seen in the above trailer, Owen has managed to grab personal, one-on-one interviews with key players Gareth Bale, Ashley Williams and Aaron Ramsey - as well as coach Coleman. Captain fantastic: Ashley Williams It was an emotional rollercoaster 
In the trailer, Wales captain Williams says he's never felt a connection with the fans like he did during Euro 2016. 
The film is being released in Wales and select cinemas on St David’s Day, 1st March, before it’s general release around the UK on 3rd March. poll loading Will you be watching 'Don't Take Me Home'? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
